title: Publication Bias: The File Drawer Problem
description: A fast breakdown of Publication Bias: The File Drawer Problem for builders.

hook.text: Journals love publishing positive results. Negative results go in a drawer. The literature gets distorted.

buildup.text: Publication bias means studies that find effects get published; studies that find nothing don't.

discovery.text: This creates a systematic overestimate of effects. We only see the hits, never the misses.

twist.text: A drug might fail in 19 trials and succeed in 1. Only the success gets published â€” making it look effective.

climax.text: Pre-registration â€” declaring your study plan before running it â€” is the main solution gaining traction.

punchline.text: What's not published shapes knowledge as much as what is.

quiz.question: What is the file drawer problem?
options: Studies with null results go unpublished, distorting the literature
